result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew S Sleaper not in court, in custody.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Andrew S Sleaper.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status conference.
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew S Sleaper appeared by video.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes appeared by video for Andrew S Sleaper.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 15 via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

JusticePoint PreTrial Services VIOLATION Report dated August 24, 2022; received and filed.
Missed Initial Office Contact.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services DISCHARGE Report dated August 26, 2022; received and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick N Save.

ADDRESS INFO for Andrew S Sleaper
Current: 4002 S VERMONT COURT #1, ST FRANCIS, WI 53235   (Effective: 08-10-2022)
Prior: 4200 South Vermont Court #1, St Francis, WI 53235
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15 for pretrial conference.  
This hearing MAY be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/104d9737-ba2f-8811-9083-aed2135824d9

Defendant Andrew S Sleaper in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Andrew S Sleaper in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Andrew S Sleaper appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued. MCSO did not provide executed warrant at time of scheduling. Defendant at MSDF  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Letter from defendant. Defendant is in custody and requests a court date. Letter forwarded to Intake Coordinator and DA's office.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Andrew S Sleaper not in court.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-27-2022 @1p
